text.p: - New law which prohibits advertising of tobacco products and trademarks except in the first 15 days after launch of new low tar product comes into force.
- Slovenian-Japanese business conference starts in Tokyo. The first promotion of Slovenian companies in Japan will be attended by representatives of 30 Slovenian companies.
- October inflation rate rose by 0.8 percent compared to September and 9.7 percent compared to the same month in 1995, Slovenia's Statistical Office reported.
- Slovenian Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek is expected to start negotiations with other political parties about forming a new government on Monday after final official election results are released.
- 14 environmental experts from Eastern and Western Europe start nine-day visit to Slovenia on Monday in order to assess efficiency of Slovenia's environmental policy.
- Slovenia's average gross salary in the first nine months of 1996 rose 14.7 percent compared to the year-ago period, Statistical Office reported.
